content: You will next receive a multiple-choice question, each with five options: A, B, C, D, and E respectively. Please provide your answer as a single letter option (your response should contain only one letter as the answer and no other text).(Notice that for the same question, if the content of the options and their labels are reassigned, the answers to both questions should still correspond to the same content, and the option itself may not the same.)

Question: Christians believe you will go to heaven if you're what?
Options: A. unable to work B. born again C. change of color D. dead E. no longer exist

Option B: Born again.

Christians believe that those who are "born again" through faith in Jesus Christ will go to heaven when they die. This idea of being "born again" refers to a person's conversion or transformation from a spiritually dead state to a new life in Christ. It is not related to other options such as being unable to work, changing color, being dead, or no longer existing.
